sentence.Network_en: Today was really a bit of a write-off for me.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天对我来说真的有点儿白白浪费了。

sentence.Network_en: The car was a write-off, but everyone escaped unharmed.
sentence.Network_cn: 这辆车报废了，但人员全部安全逃离。

sentence.Network_en: The president persuaded the West to write off Polish debts.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统说通西方免除波兰的债务。

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... write down 写下；把…描写成 write off 注销；勾销；写信寄出 write out 写出，全部写出.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... write down 写下；把…描写成 write off 注销；勾销；写信寄出 write out 写出，全部写出.

entry.def: Something such as a vehicle that is a write-off has been so badly damaged in an accident that it is not worth repairing.

example.ex: The car was a write-off, but everyone escaped unharmed.
example.tran: 这辆车报废了，但人员全部安全逃离。

entry.def: A write-off is the decision by a company or government to accept that they will never recover a debt or an amount of money that has been spent on something.

example.ex: Mr James persuaded the banks to accept a large write-off of debt.
example.tran: 詹姆斯先生说服银行同意注销一大笔债务。

entry.tran: 失败的计划;白费的时间
entry.def: If you describe a plan or period of time as a write-off, you mean that it has been a failure and you have achieved nothing.

example.ex: Today was really a bit of a write-off for me...
example.tran: 今天对我来说真的有点儿白白浪费了。

example.ex: For him, the rest of the decade was a creative write-off.
example.tran: 对他来说，这个十年所余下的时间是一段创作空白。

means.word_mean: 1. (accounting) reduction in the book value of an asset
2. the act of cancelling from an account a bad debt or a worthless asset

sentences.en: They escaped with minor injuries but the van was a write-off.
sentences.cn: 他们受了点轻伤脱险,可是客货车却报废了。
